info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 07 at 2:56PM EDT until July 07 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN GREENVILLE AND NORTHEASTERN PICKENS COUNTIES... At 256 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Pickens, or 7 miles southwest of Slater-Marietta, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Travelers Rest, Slater-Marietta, Paris Mountain State Park, Table Rock State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Pumpkintown, Dacusville, Sassafras Mountain, Rocky Bottom and Furman University. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
